definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
to lose the way/lost/labyrinth/labyrinthus vestibularis (of the inner ear)
to wander off/to stray/to get lost
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to run around all over the place
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
